definition[0]: a favourable report, opinion, or reaction shows that you think that someone or something is good or that you agree with them
example[1]: The response has been overwhelmingly favorable.
definition[1]: suitable and likely to make something happen or succeed
example[2]: The disease spreads quickly under favourable conditions.
example[3]: a financial environment that is favorable to job creation
definition[2]: if a loan, agreement, rate etc is favourable, the conditions of it are reasonable and not too expensive or difficult
example[5]: the favorable terms of the settlement
definition[3]: making people like or approve of someone or something
example[6]: A smart appearance makes a favourable impression at an interview.
